intro: Pavetta virungensis, commonly known as the Virunga pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the montane forests of central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant typically grows as a small shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and are usually white or pale pink in color. Pavetta virungensis is adapted to the humid, shaded environments of its native habitat and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
